document.discussion_title: More kills, less thrills: Deaths trump nudity for Game of Thrones fans
document.topic_text: Search More kills, less thrills: Deaths trump nudity for Game of Thrones fans The video will start in 8s Cancel Click to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Naked women in Game of Thrones can actually turn viewers off, according to ratings. Analysis of Game of Thrones' IMDB scores has revealed (oo-er) that episodes with nude scenes are rated lower than episodes with no naked women at all. Across all five seasons of the HBO drama, episodes with no nude scenes achieved an average rating of 9.1 out of 10, while those with one nude scene got an average score of 8.94 and those with multiple nude scenes got an average of... read more Related news Hull Daily Mail , 6 April 2014 in Yorkshire & Humber Game of Thrones' deadliest characters: We reveal the top 10 killers The video will start in 8s Cancel Click to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started If you're a Game of Thrones fan, you've probably learned by now not to get too attached to any of the characters. At any... Examiner , Friday, 18:03 in Yorkshire & Humber Sheffield actor Sean Bean tells American TV that Donald Trump is a 'buffoon' Sheffield born actor Sean Bean poked fun at US Presidential hopeful Donald Trump during a live interview on American television last night. Game of Thrones star Bean, who was raised in Handsworth, was appearing on the hit talk show Larry King Live.... Sheffield Telegraph , 14 January 2016 in Yorkshire & Humber Fans injured after crash by Barnsley rider in the TT Spectators had to be taken to hospital after a Barnsley biker crashed into the crowd at a famous racing event. Jonathan Howarth, known as Jono, was competing in the Senior TT race on the Isle of Man yesterday afternoon when the collision occurred. The... South Yorkshire Times , 8 June 2013 in Yorkshire & Humber Hull FC: 'We've found blueprint for success' - Lee Radford LEE Radford says his Hull FC side have found a blueprint for success which they can use to keep climbing the Super League ladder. A more adventurous Hull staged a dramatic comeback at Warrington to beat the Wolves 27-26, thanks to Marc Sneyd's... Hull Daily Mail , 11 May 2015 in Yorkshire & Humber Scunthorpe United failed to 'stick the knife in' when on top at Colchester United, admits boss Mark Robins SCUNTHORPE United manager Mark Robins said he was disappointed with his side's 2-2 draw with Colchester United - but admitted they have to be more ruthless during games. Goals from Kevin van Veen and Paddy Madden put the Iron 2-0 up with less than 20... Scunthorpe Telegraph , 30 August 2015 in Yorkshire & Humber
